summary: This bill, the Francis G. Newlands Memorial Removal Act, directs the Secretary of the Interior to remove or conceal the name of Francis G. Newlands from the memorial fountain at Chevy Chase Circle in Washington, D.C. It mandates the removal of the plaque, a stone projection, and any name carvings.  The items removed will be offered to Newlands' descendants for 60 days; otherwise, they will become National Park Service property and part of the Rock Creek Park museum collection. The bill defines the memorial fountain's location.
